embeds.title: Wide Sting
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 2 (1) :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

Deal 7 - 12 damage to ALL enemies.
**Upgrade** all **Offclass** cards in your hand.

messages.content: *insert snecko rant here*
<armaments> but bad and needs the upgrade even more!

embeds.title: Armaments
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 1 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Gain 5 **Block** :p_block:.
**Upgrade** a (all) card (cards) in your hand for the rest of combat.

messages.content: I’m a huge fan of this one early on. You can take care of your AoE needs without using an identify and upgrading a few cards can get you even more damage early game. I probably wouldn’t take it past act 1 though

I wonder if Snecko's own cards are deliberately underwhelming to push you to use offclass cards instead of just relying on Snecko's native cards in every run. Kind of like how Strikes and Defends are deliberately underwhelming to encourage you to draft cards. (I've played a deckbuilder that didn't understand why most deckbuilders have this design choice. It was boring.)
But if that's the case... they could probably still stand to be buffed a bit. It's not like a less bad <Dice Crush> would carry you throughout the whole game.

embeds.title: Dice Crush
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 2 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

Deal 10 (14) - 16 (20) damage.

messages.content: You definitely won't expect a card like this to have an energy cost upgrade and yet it does
It's pretty good, in some ways it's even better than Apo on Snecko since he's so focused on generating new cards mid combat
I usually take it and I rarely regret it
Wide sting along side <slither strike> can give you insane value on a hand full of random offclass cards

embeds.title: Slither Strike
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 1 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

Deal 9 (12) damage.
Reduce the cost of **Offclass** cards in your hand by 1 this turn.

messages.content: This card is really bad unupgraded, but actually pretty good upgraded. There is no unidentified area of effect packs, so this is likely your only guaranteed aoe card in the early game for snecko.

Well, this card, and several others like cheap stock, slither strike, and exotic form do directly incentivize using offclass cards. I do feel that sneckos core design does heavily encourage "prismatic shard the character" type play, and it is probably fair to say that their own cards are also a bid understatted to encourage picking up the unidentified off class cards more often.

I've used this card fairly often in snecko runs, as reliable AOE is very hard to find with the unidentified cards, and pretty necessary for hard pool hallway fights in act 1, and most hallways and elites in act 2. The numbers on it aren't very good, especially for a 2 cost card, and that does make the upgrade really important to bring it in line with where it should be (you can get greedy and delay the upgrade, hoping to hit some combination of snecko eye, master eye, or tons of muddle instead). It does deal more damage on average than cleave, and upgrading all of your off class cards can be pretty helpful, notably capable of hitting the 2 unidentified basics you start with, and it can also affect other cards generated mid combat by transforms.

I don't think you take this card because it's really good, but because the affect it offers (AOE damage) is so scare on the character, and at least it has some muddle synergy, which snecko often ends up using. It's usually a good idea to take and upgrade a copy of this in act 1, though you can skip it if you find a way to identify a better AOE card. Can synergize with necronomicon, loaded die helps it a bit, and is good with runic pyramid to upgrade a large number of cards at once. I really dislike the range cards in general, as the results can be very swingy, and the numbers tend to be very poor, even at the top of the range on most of them, though on this particular card it's probably right about where it should be after upgrading it (which is still a significant cost, especially when upgrades are fighting with identifies for campfire actions).
Yeah range cards just aren't fun nor balanced. The way to evaluate them is value them at the lowest possible result, and think of anything else as just extra.
Luckily many of them are garbage regardless of the rng just because they are extremely understatted so it doesn't matter
like <dice block>

embeds.title: Dice Block
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 2 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

Gain 8 (12) - 12 (16) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: It would be *decent* if it high rolled 100% of the time.
but obviously it doesn't
you can really pay 2 energy and get the same block as a defend+
it would be mediocre if it highrolled all the time
2 cost 12 block is *slightly* better than 2 defends

comparing that to other 2 cost block cards from other characters, it is so apparent how bad it is. Usually I am against comparing cards cross character, however snecko has access to all cards so these cards are all technically in snecko's pool.
<dash> block numbers are the same (slightly worse when upgraded) as the average of dice block. Dash also does damage.

embeds.title: Dash
embeds.description:
Uncommon Attack / 2 :green_energy: / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Gain 10 (13) **Block** :p_block:.
Deal 10 (13) damage.

messages.content: dash doesn't make nob angry

also:
[[wash]]

embeds.title: Wash
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 2 :colorless_energy: / The Brainlets / The Brainlets

Gain 11 **Block** :p_block:.
Reduce each of your debuffs by 1 (2).

messages.content: you would much rather have this than dice block
even if dice block always gave 12 block
<protect> is considered not that strong of a card, and matches the HIGH ROLL of dice block, while also retaining.

embeds.title: Protect
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 2 :purple_energy: / The Watcher / Slay the Spire

**Retain**.
Gain 12 (16) **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: THAT RETAINS
dice block is just a horrible card that has 0 identity besides being useless. I get that "oh you can muddle it to be cheaper" yes but so can any other 2 cost block card.
I do have a terrible idea for dice block
but well
it's a shitty idea
I mean, probably can't be much worse than the current one
"gain 0 - 40 block"
average 20
I did say it was a shitty idea
Honestly at least it would have an identity. I'd rather have a character with a lot of ghost shield like cards (one that is overpowered and overcentralizing) than literal nothing cards.
that idea was more a meme than anything
embracing the "Let's go gambling!!!!" identity of snecko
https://tenor.com/view/lets-go-gambling-gif-4822326163116896763
snecko rn
sorry for bringing up *the* card, it was more about the idea of it than an actual comparison of functionality
it's fine

besides:
[[mistakes of the past]]

embeds.description:
Special Skill / 1 :colorless_energy: / Colorless / The Brainlets
